# Abstract
This section shall give a as concise as possible overview what this repository/product
is about. It shall not be longer than 3 sentences.

# Usage
This section is intended for the users of the tool/product contained in this repository.
It shall describe how they use it or, of its e.g. a library, how to integrate it into
their own products. It shall have the following subsections:
## Prerequisites
which tools / libraries / .dlls or .sos are required to use the product.
## Installation
how to install the product, e.g. download links, installation commands

# Development
This section is intended for developers working on this repository/product.
It shall describe how to set up a development environment, how to build and test the product,
and how to contribute to it.
It shall have the following subsections:
## Setup
which tools / libraries / .dlls or .sos are required to set up a development environment.
e.g. cmake, specific database drivers, specific IDE plugins, etc.
## Build
how to build the tool/product from source, e.g. build commands, required tools. e.g. cargo
or maven for java
## Test
how to test the tool/product, e.g. unit tests, integration tests, local execution tests
## Contributing
### Branching Strategy
e.g. gitflow, github flow, trunk based development or custom
### Release Strategy
e.g. own release branches for every major version with tags (for supporting multiple
versions in parallel), or only tag on master
### Other conventions
e.g. tag names (e.g. v1.2.3 or 1.2.3), versioning (semver or other), commit message conventions
